task.title: Step 4 - Validate Your Implementation
task.shortdesc: Ensure that everything is set up correctly on the site and ensure it appears in reporting.

step.cmd: Obtain DigitalPulse Debugger, which lets you see Analytics variables while visiting your website.
Navigate to your new Web page, or open the saved HTML file on your hard drive. Open DigitalPulse Debugger.
Review the above steps to ensure everything was done correctly and try again.

info.p: The pageName parameter is Test Page. If you see a window that says No requests found, it means there is an issue with your implementation.

step.cmd: Once verified in DigitalPulse Debugger, wait several hours to give the processing servers time to populate reports.
Login to reporting and analytics. Go to Site Content > Pages.
Look for Test Page with one or more page views.

info.p: If you see page views in the report, you have successfully implemented Analytics on a page. When implementing on multiple pages, the Page Code must be present on each, but can reference the same core Javascript file. Each page can also have their own variables such as props, eVars, products, campaigns, and so forth.
If you require assistance implementing code on your site, contact your organization's account manager who can arrange a meeting with an Adobe Implementation Consultant.
